result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy Lee Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/14/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 7/14/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for medical care. Credit for 4 days time served.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor.
Defendant may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy Lee Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court denied defendant's request for release privileges.  Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 07/17/14. AR

Defendant Stacy Lee Johnson in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for medical care. 
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 7/14/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Stacy Lee Johnson in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ sAB
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/14/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Stacy Lee Johnson in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial in Branch 15.  Jury trial scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stacy Lee Johnson in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-27-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Stacy Lee Johnson in court with attorney Ann T Bowe.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
